channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: Shaheen Bagh, India’s citizenship law protest site, Delhi’s newest food hub
item.description: The mainly Muslim neighbourhood, once the site of a months-long sit-in, now draws foodies from around the world.

item.title: Trump, Biden clash over Transgender Day of Visibility falling on Easter
item.description: Trump camp decries 'assault on the Christian faith', while White House blasts 'cruel, hateful, and dishonest rhetoric'.

item.title: Car bomb kills at least seven in Syrian town near Turkish border
item.description: Blast occurred in Syrian opposition city of Azaz during peak late night shopping after breaking the day's Ramadan fast.

item.title: Polls open in Turkey local elections in key test of Erdogan’s popularity
item.description: Vote will decide who gets to control Istanbul and capital Ankara, both of which the Turkish president lost in 2019.

item.title: Ramadan 2024: Where do your dates come from?
item.description: Egypt, Saudi Arabia and Algeria produce nearly half the world’s dates.

item.title: Gaza truce talks set to resume, as thousands protest Netanyahu in Israel
item.description: Negotiations on Sunday come after UN Security Council demanded a ceasefire this week, nearly six months into the war.

item.title: What shapes Turkey’s municipal elections?
item.description: Turks go to the polls on Sunday to choose mayors and local government officials.

item.title: Zelenskyy fires aides in reshuffle, Russia launches air attack on Ukraine
item.description: Top aide Serhiy Shefir was among those dismissed as well as three advisers and two presidential representatives.

item.title: Belfast mural artists put up powerful show of solidarity with Gaza
item.description: Belfast's iconic International Wall has been transformed by local artists into the Palestinian Wall.

item.title: Aid ships with nearly 400 tonnes of food depart Cyprus for Gaza
item.description: Saturday's shipment marks the second delivery by sea as Gaza faces imminent famine while Israel continues to block aid.

item.title: ‘Complicity’: Leaders, activists slam US for sending more arms to Israel
item.description: Media reports say the US has agreed to transfer a new weapons package worth $2.5bn to Israel amid its ongoing Gaza war.

item.title: Chocolate prices to keep rising as West Africa’s cocoa crisis deepens
item.description: Top growers in Ivory Coast and Ghana are facing catastrophic harvests, resulting in record-high cocoa prices.

item.title: Malaysia store attacked over ‘Allah’ socks
item.description: The KK Super Mart chain apologised after photos of the socks on sale caused widespread anger among Muslims.

item.title: What is the economic cost of Baltimore’s bridge collapse?
item.description: The Baltimore port's closure could cost the economy $15m per day while insurers face up to $3bn in claims.

item.title: UN observers wounded in explosion while on patrol in southern Lebanon
item.description: UN mission in Lebanon says targeting of peacekeepers 'unacceptable' as Israeli military denies striking area.

item.title: Delusions at the United Nations
item.description: It is absurd to believe that UNSC resolutions and ICJ orders can stop the Israeli genocide in Gaza.

item.title: US to impose visa restrictions on Hong Kong officials over rights concerns
item.description: US says crackdown by Hong Kong officials includes new national security law targeting treason, espionage, other crimes.

item.title: Meta’s oversight board urges Facebook, Instagram to lift ban on ‘shaheed’
item.description: The advisory board has told Meta the ban on the word, meaning 'martyr', restricts free expression and is unnecessary.

item.title: Communing with spirits and coping with death: Grief food in three cultures
item.description: From Russia to Sri Lanka, rituals around the preparation and eating of special 'grief food' bring comfort to mourners.

item.title: Netherlands nightclub standoff ends with hostages freed, suspect in custody
item.description: Police said there was no indication of a 'terrorist motive' after four people were held in the town of Ede.

item.title: The cracks are deepening in the US-Israel alliance
item.description: Cracks in the special US-Israel relationship cannot be hidden any longer - rifts are showing.

item.title: Japan raids factory making health supplements linked to deaths
item.description: Government orders review of approval system for health products in response to supplement-related illnesses.

item.title: Peru President Dina Boluarte’s home raided in luxury watch investigation
item.description: Dozens of officers involved in operation to locate Rolex watches President Boluarte has reportedly not disclosed.

item.title: Senegal’s fishermen pin hopes on new president to help them fill their nets
item.description: As foreign boats and illegal trawlers lower fish stocks, local fishers want Diomaye Faye's government to bring change.

item.title: US approves bombs, jets for Israel amid threat of offensive in Gaza’s Rafah
item.description: White House authorises transfer of $2.5bn of warplanes and weapons to Israel, The Washington Post reports.
